rComments: How to get an A in this class -Read all the grey example boxes because he likes to pick from those -Section will teach you what you need for the week and basically how to do the hmwk -This is a law class so be very careful and precise with language in your written answers -know the fundamentals of each economic legal structure like how and why

Initially thought this was going to be an easy class, but I was wrong. Wittman had some entertaining lectures, but at times they were very boring. The assignments ( 5 HW, 5 Midterms) were toughly graded. Section cleared some things for me. Went to office hours once, but he was not helpful at all. Book can be found for free online. Easy to pass

What a character. Very easy class, the tests are basically the homework questions. Never needed it but both him and the TA were eager to help anyone who was struggling. If you can memorize mathcomputer science input equations this class is a piece of cake, while also having you think differently than before. Good experience overall

Wittman is awesome. He writes the reader for his classes, and everything that you would possibly need is in them. I took 113 and 115 with him and it was crazy easy. A's in both classes no problem. Take it.
Wittman is great. really nice guy, funny, and clear. always willing to help students. cant say enough good things.

This is one of the most interesting econ classes at UCSC. All you do is solve math problems, usually in the context of business. It is an intro course to management science/operations research/decision science. Wittman is smart and entertaining, but several students had trouble grasping the material. Tests were fair, and be sure to attend lecture.

Donald is hilarious and engaging. He tries to learn everyone's names and makes jokes when he forgets. He is sarcastic and is very attentive to the class demeanor, and the way his lectures progress. Lectures are great for understanding, but every once in a while he pulls a test question that was only covered in the text--read the text; it's short!

Great professor. Interesting lectures. 10% HW and 90% Tests(5).  85% and up is an A, 70% and up is a B, 60% and up is a C. Txt is easy to read, cheap, and PDF is online for free.  All that being said, the tests are graded very hard. Must be stated identically to the language of the book. Do not use your own words. Easy B, Hard A

I recommend to take all of Wittman's classes. They are all interesting and he knows the stuff. He also make sure the students understand the materials and there are no surprises on the exams. Everything is based on the readings/powerpoints. You just have to go to class, section, do the practice questions and old exams to past his classes

This teacher was very insightful, funny, and clear. The material was interesting but the way it's taught makes it ten times more comprehendable. Requires a lot of studying but a high payoff in return. Donald knows his stuff!
he didn't teach what was on the midterms and didn't give answers for review problems until after the tests were done.

THIS CLASS IS VERY INTERESTING B/C OF WITTMAN. THE GRADING DEPENDS ON THE TA, WHEN I TOOK IT THE TAS GRADED REALLY HARD BUT WHEN OTHER PPL TOOK IT THEY TOLD ME THEIR TA GRADED FAIRLY. HOWEVER, I DO SUGGEST EVERYONE TO TAKE THIS CLASS, JUST MAKE SURE YOU READ AND GO OVER ALL THE PRACTICE QUESTIONS. THEY ARE VERY SIMILAR TO THE MIDTERM!

I really felt the grading was unfair and picked out errors in grading on each of my 4 midterms.  But Wittman was a good, clear and entertaining teacher, and the material was awesome.  If you enjoy mathematical puzzles (which certainly isn't everyone), this is a great class to take.

Wittman is awesome. The material was complex but with the professor's reader and help from the TAs it is not difficult to do well. I received a B and feel I earned exactly that. His tests are relevant and a good test of your knowledge. (exams occur every two weeks which sucks but the final is not comprehensive and short)

Everyone loves Wittman but I'm going to have to differ. He is alright. I guess he's entertaining if you're into old men who are absentminded. One on One he's not that cool at all. He's actually a jerk. He makes you feel bad if you did badly on one of his tests. He's pompous, if you ask me. I don't recommend this class for econ majors.

Wittman wrote the book, and its the most concise, witty and impressive of those I've read for the econ major. His lectures are very fun. He is very talented at involving students. He is also way smarter than he leads on; I recommend reading his published research because they are also treasures.

My FAVORITE professor at UCSC.  He is so awesome, so funny, and extremely fair.  His class was interesting and he really makes an effort to learn everyone's name and encourage student questions.  Really wants people to understand and succeed.

I fell asleep for the first 45 minutes of every lecture and still got an A-.  He wrote the book for the class and his lectures just further explain it to those who can't comprehend the reading.  No need to go to class if you don't live on campus or if you can read at a 9th grade level.  Other than to turn in homework or take tests.
this was one of the greatest classes i've taken.  wittman is one of the best professors.  strongly recommend him.  the class is easy if you do the readings.  take the class if you can!!

Prof. Wittman is rather funny. Likes the class to be involved. Homework and Exams (non-cumulative) happen every 2 weeks, so it keeps you up to date on the material. Even though sometimes it doesn't feel like what you learn is that applicable outside class, you actually walk away having learned a ton. Great professor, and interesting course.

i LOVE wittman!! He cares about his students and he wants everybody to succeed. class is pretty easy (thanks to wittman) and cheap! no text book, just $30 reader.  the outline of the class makes it so simple. just go to section and you will do well.  55% is a C... so how could you not? TAKE THIS CLASS. i will take all of wittmans classes.

legal studies majors: TAKE THIS CLASS. I'm in law school now and this was the single most useful class I took for law school in the major. The topics are discussed over and over again in property and torts. Plus, I found it really interesting, even though I thought it would be horrible and only took it to met a requirement. Donald is amazing.

Best Econ professor I've had here. For Econ 169, you have a test every two weeks, which really makes things less stressful. He is easy but you learn a lot AND it's interesting. Really hilarious too. He is very helpful outside of class too.
The worst teacher ever!  Not attractive and such a boring subject and way he teaches.. i highly do NOT recommend this man, hes very dry!

Econ 169 is also offered as a legal studies course, although only a few legal studies students take it.  I was one of the few, and at first was afraid that I wouldn't succeed in the class. What a joke!  I got an A+ and after the second half I stopped going to lecture. If you take his class, you'll know why!

i adore donald. he is certainly the best and most interesting econ professor ive had here at ucsc. while not difficult, you learn alot and thats what counts. your pretty much guranteed an A if you pay attention and go to all the TA sections. the homework is manageable and the 2 week tests he gives certainly turns down the pressure in the class.

This class was quite easy, all test questions (to my recollection) came from the few review questions at the end of each chapter.  Reading was very light and yet substantive.  The class introduces an unorthodox and insightful approach to law and Wittman teaches it articulately.  He is clear and reasonable in his expectations of students.

This class is a joke.  If you stay half awake during the lectures, and do the homework, you'll get an A+.  The lectures progress VERY slowly, because he makes sure everyone understand the material.  It's a bit scary to think that this is one of the upper division major core requirements...

The class is pretty boring, but a must for all econ majors and Wittman knows his stuff and teaches in a way that allows students to asks questions. Made material less dry and is tests are very straight forward. You know how to apply the material or you don't.
He is the man. He takes the most boring information and makes it fun.  His tests are fair and direct. Highly recommend and definitely hoping to take another class from him.
Very good teacher.  Keeps the lectures interesting, gives fair exams, and is a very fair grader.  I'd highly recommend him.

Great professor, if you go to lectures, he will go over everything necessary for the test.  Reading is light if you keep up with it - the supplementary book had nightmarishly small text though.  Just don't be one of those idiots who never come to class and just the final.  Jerks.

easy class.  he lectures right of the reader so attending class isn't necessary, altho his lectures are very interesting and funny at times.  light work load with some reading and generally easy to approach.
Definitely good at keeping his lectures interesing.  His examples always seem to include controlled substances for some reason :-P
great professor. makes a great effort to make sure everyone is understanding the material. his enthusiasm makes an otherwise boring topic interesting.
